intro: Semiphajus chevalieri, commonly known as the Chevalier's semipalmate, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its distinctive palmate leaves with five to seven lobes. The plant produces small, showy flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded, forested areas. Due to habitat loss, Semiphajus chevalieri is considered endangered and is the subject of conservation efforts.
